alert.note: Alert for Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 5:49PM EDT until June 23 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Schuylkill. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 549 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pottsville, Tamaqua, Schuylkill Haven, Mahanoy City, Orwigsburg, Port Carbon, Hometown, Tuscarora, New Philadelphia, Grier City-Park Crest, Renningers, McKeansburg, Locust Lake State Park, New Boston-Morea, Lake Wynonah, Cressona, Palo Alto, Auburn, Deer Lake and Cumbola. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
